result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd M Guider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DE will complete an evidence based Domestic Abuse Intervention Program.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA/pay surcharge.

DE cannot possess firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored. 

DE will have credit for 62 days if revoked. 

2022GF43 CONSOLIDATED INTO 2022CF42

Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd M Guider

records.addlTxt:
3:40 PM Prosecuting attorney Annette M Barna in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Todd M Guider in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Todd M Guider.  Both cases 20CM106 and 22CF42 heard at the same time.   Court informed DE he has the right to speak with his attorney and the Court will make arrangements should they need to discuss the case.  Court reviewed Case Settlement and reviewed plea agreement with DE.  Court reviewed Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form with DE.  DE understands his rights.  Court reviewed elements of offenses, repeater enh. and max. penalties with DE.   Court explained DE of domestic abuse enh. and the $100 assessment for both counts.  State informed Court victims' rights were complied with.  Court informed DE he cannot possess a firearm based upon felony conviction.   Court informed DE of his voting rights.  
20CM106:  DE plea NC to Battery as a domestic abuse and Repeater and DC as a domestic abuse and Repeater.  The remaining count dismissed but read in.  
22CF42:  DE plead NC to Poss of a Firearm by a Felon as a Repeater.  The remained counts dismissed but read in.
State argument as to disposition.    Attorney Rockow argument.   DE made a statement to the Court.
Court sentenced per joint recommendation:
22CF42:  W/H sentence,  3 years probation.
20CM106:  W/H sentence, 2 years probation.
Conditions of probation:  Defendant will complete an Evidence based DAIP, submit DNA sample and pay surcharge, and pay court costs.    DE informed to report to DOC by tomorrow after work.  
Adj. 4:12 PM
Court granted 62 days jail credit in 22CF42 and 7 days jail credit in 20CM106.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 6, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

9:19 AM Defendant Todd M Guider in court.  Attorney Annette M Barna appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Todd M Guider. Heard along with 20CM106, 22CF42.  Agreement has been reached in this matter, Atty asking for a P/S time. SEt for July 6, 2022 @ 4:00PM. Adj 9:21am
Review hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:14 AM Defendant Todd M Guider in court.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Todd M Guider. Heard along with 20CM106 and 22CF42.

22CF42-Waive reading of the information, enter a plea of NG. Set both cases for June 21, 2022 @ 9:00AM.

Atty would like like bond amended to say to verbally or physically abusive contact with GJ. So ordered. Adj 11:03
No verbal or physically abusive contact with J.G.

03:26 PM Defendant Todd M Guider in court with attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow.  Defendant Todd M Guider in custody.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Todd M Guider appeared by video means with Attorney.  Heard along with 2020CM106, 22CF42.  3:33PM Back on the record from breakout.  DE has no objection to ADA Nelson handling the PH in 22CF42.  Court has colluqoy with DE on Waiver of conflict for today's purposes.  State calls Sgt Matthew Wojcik, oath given. Direct by the State.  Record shall reflect the witness has identifed the DE.  Court will receive the Certified copy of JOC filed by the State.  Cross by Atty Rockow.   Witness dismissed.  Court finds PC, will bind over for Trial.  Set for Arraignment May 17, 2022 @ 10:30AM.  Adj 3:44PM

Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Defendant Todd M Guider.  Cases 20CM106 and 22CF42 heard together.  20CM106 set for STC. 22CF42 set for INIT.      
22CF42:  DE received the CC.   Waive reading.  DE understands charges and penalties.  Attorney Rockow argued for a $500 cash bond or less.   DA argued for $1000 cash bond and any nonmonetary conditions that were in place before.  Court ordered $500 cash bond with condition No verbal or physical contact with J.G.   PH set for 3/30/22 at 3:00 PM.   
20CM106:  Set for STC ib 3/30/22 at 3:00 PM.
